answerText: Brownian motion[10]  Brownian motion can be modeled using this equation that describes the time evolution of a variable as a sum of a nonlinear function of the variable and a oscillating random term.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Seven Lakes/Rockefeller  | 6 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The Fluctuation-Dissipation theorem has its origins in the study of this phenomenon. For 10 points each: [10] Name this seemingly random drifting of suspended particles, discovered by a botanist while working with pollen suspended in water.
